intro: Dicliptera haughtii, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a flowering plant species native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that thrives in saline and brackish water environments, often found in mangrove ecosystems. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. Dicliptera haughtii plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
